Key Match Events: Domantas Sabonis tied the game going 2-for-2 from the free throw line with 51 seconds remaining.

Tyler Herro had been torching the Kings early and often in this game, finishing with 26 points. The Kings put Keegan Murray on Herro in the fourth quarter, and Herro’s impact was suddenly gone. 5 points in the 4th, 0 in OT, 0 in the 2nd OT.
Malik Monk drew a foul with 0.2 seconds left and made his second free throw to tie the game. The Heat couldn’t do anything with the 0.2 seconds remaining, and the game went to a second overtime.
DeMar DeRozan scored the final 9 points for the Kings, including a three-pointer that ended up being a Mitch Richmond 2, as DeRozan’s toe was just barely on the line.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance.
Coach Steve Kerr emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense.
The duel between Kevin Durant and Giannis Antetokounmpo was highlighted as the key matchup.
Post-Match Reflections: The team ended a 20-year championship drought.
The coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A power outage delayed the game by 30 minutes.
